subject: Real Estate
title: Tax Havens and Property Laundering
description: A micro-lesson that makes Tax Havens and Property Laundering usable.

hook.text: $2 trillion in illicit money flows into real estate each year. Property is the world's favorite money laundering tool.

buildup.text: Shell companies, trusts, and offshore entities hide the real owners of luxury properties in London and New York.

discovery.text: The Panama Papers revealed that world leaders, oligarchs, and criminals owned property through anonymous companies.

twist.text: The U.S. still allows anonymous LLCs to buy property in most states â€” a legal loophole regulators struggle to close.

climax.text: Real estate's opacity makes it the ideal vehicle for hiding wealth. Bricks and mortar ask no questions.

punchline.text: Real estate is the world's largest money laundering machine.

quiz.question: How much illicit money flows into real estate annually?
